intro: Homalobus fendleri, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces capsules that contain numerous small, elliptical seeds. It is adapted to dry environments and has a deep root system for water absorption. Homalobus fendleri plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
